New Records: Canada registered its first-ever T20 World Cup win.
Key Match Events: Canada beat Ireland by 12 runs in their Group A match.
Ireland needed 17 runs off the last over but fell short.
Jeremy Gordon took a crucial wicket in the final over.
Nicholas Kirton scored 49 runs for Canada.
Barry McCarthy took two wickets in the 19th over for Ireland.
Curtis Campher and George Dockrell had notable performances for Ireland.
Pre-Game Insights: Ireland won the toss and elected to bowl.
The pitch was expected to be sluggish due to overnight rain.
The match was played at Nassau County International Cricket Stadium in New York.
Post-Match Reflections: Canada's win moved them above Pakistan in the Group A points table.
The match was significant as it marked Canada's first win in T20 World Cup history.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch conditions in New York have been under scrutiny due to low-scoring matches.
The match was part of the T20 World Cup 2024.
